tool.name: Tool5

param.name: aaa_folder
param.displayname: Folder that contains case and control summary folders
param.dialogReference: (An Intersect_M1M2, Union_M1, Union_M2, or Union_M1M2 folder)This folder should contain two subfolders: Controls and Mortality. These subfolders must include CSV files with summary exposure data for the respective calculation types (median, accum, max, min).

param.name: timeframes_num2
param.dialogReference: Defines the number of years to be considered in the window analysis. This parameter controls the range of the window analysis over different timeframes.

param.name: attrib_file
param.displayname: Attribute Data File (containing controls and cases)
param.dialogReference: This CSV file should contain attribute data, such as demographic information (age, sex), that will be joined with the window analysis data based on study_ID.

param.name: output_folder
param.displayname: Output folder for Window Analysis files
param.dialogReference: This is the parent folder where the results will be saved. The tool creates subfolders for each calculation type (e.g., median_Output, accum_Output, etc.) and saves the results accordingly. It also generates subfolders for log-transformed results.

tool.summary:
This tool processes case and control summary exposure data (CSV files) and runs a rolling window analysis on the data. It produces both log-transformed and non-log-transformed results, saving them as CSV files. The tool supports multiple calculation types (e.g., median, accum, max, min) and organizes outputs into corresponding folders.

After performing the window analysis, the tool creates both non-log-transformed and log-transformed CSV files. Log-transformed files undergo two steps: multiplication by 1,000,000 and logarithmic scaling (log10(x + 1)).

The tool outputs the results in subfolders organized by calculation type and log transformation.
